reviews.sentence: Fees were ridiculous. The bed and pillows. They charged me for parking. And the room was small. Comfortable bed but not good enough for how much I paid for just one night.

Old hotel being renovated. This is a old hotel that is being renovated. The linens customer service and price where good. The bathrooms where tiny and impossible to get ready with two people. Overall you get what you pay for.

Room was great. Staff see comments. Hotel Room was excellent for the price. Everything worked hot water everything was clean. Hotel Front Desk Staff needs to improve in areas of customer service. They need to acknowledge their is a guest in front of them. Ignoring them while they do other task is not acceptable. Taking one second to say Hello I will be with in one moment.
it is okay for the price and for the location right in downtown LA. Comfortable beds. Nice views of LATherere a weird vibe to the whole place. The staff is not very good.

Great renovated rooms at a great rate. We were given a recently renovated room at an incredible rate. The room was beautiful we may have been the first guests to stay in it. The staff was friendly and checkin was quick. The view was great. The recently renovated shower was difficult to get just right pressure temperature but that is common with hotels. The cool bluetoth USB connection to the TV did not seem to work but it is not something we cared about.

Great deal especially for the price and perfect location for what we needed. The bed was really comfortable and we really enjoyed the view. We had a room in the corner top room it made it almost panoramic. The last day it was hot in our room we thought the AC broke but we were informed that maintenance had turned the heat on because it was cooler outside.

Good value. but I could not sleep in this hotel for some reason. Perhaps there are ghosts in the buildingAs I told myself as me and a friend stayed at the Historic Mayfair Hotel a 1926 hotel that retains its old look but inside things have been modernized. While we went to this hotel to commute to the Los Angeles Convention Center for E3 the price was fantastic and for the most part not often do I get a chance to stay in a hotel this old. While we were able to walk to restaurants which are not too far what kind of freaked me out were certain noises no I am not going to say this hotel is haunted. but suffice to say I went two days with not much sleep. Perhaps I was too paranoid or a bit creeped out but I was unable to sleep at all. Needless to say the room was adequate for two people and for its price during E3 it was hard to beat the price. But it was the first time I booked a hotel which I could not sleep that well. But nevertheless for its value and the fact it is old and historic. may appeal to others looking for an inexpensive hotel.

Pleasantly surprised. We needed to find a hotel that was close by to the LA shrine Auditorium and this was the perfect spot they Mayfair had the best prices in town because all the other hotels were over 300. We got a king size bed for 100 bucks which you can not be for downtown LA belly parking was OK for 20 a little expensive but at least our car was safe the room was superclean and the view was spectacular we read the reviews online and we were skeptical at first but we will definitely be staying there again.

The rates are accurate if not worse. Hotel is in the the bad side of downtown LA. Woke up to gun shots one night scary. Phone did not work in room told the staff 5X nothing was done. 7 days of my stay my phone to my room never worked. Cleaning staff amazing did a fabulous job very impressed. Valet Parking service more friendly then the hotel staff loved them tipped them well. Also some floors are under contruction so is one elevator this is annoying because you can hear the drilling off on in the morning. Workers are taking up the use of the elevators in the early day so that is a bit fustrating. Two Star is correct for this place. will not stay here again when I am back in LA.
It was nice to pay a convinient price for this room in downtown LA. Staff is so nice rooms are renovated and cozy.

do not STAY THERE. During the night I was bitten all over by insects bedbugs. fleas. and have insect bites all over my body. Obviously I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. They gave me a free breakfast and said they would refund me 25 of the room cost but I would have to reach out to get that refund. Not sure how to do that.

So if you are planing to sleep some time after 9 think again. They should specify that point before that we went to the hotel. 2. The parking cost 36 dolars per day. More than the room. Just cross the street and there have like half price. This was really enoying.

Never felt this unsafe should not be open for bus. I am a solo female traveller in my mid 20s. I have never felt so unsafe being in a street next to the dodgey areas. Slums were just next door my friend who works for the government arrested drug addicts and dealers there. Hotel facilities at the basement were non existent. They are under renovation and I paid 200 USD a night. yeah it is 4th of July. Only 1 elevator that is working no front lobby as they were under renovation. If you want to be open for business do nt charge people 20USD a night. I arrived after a 15 hour flight and wanted just rest. I was asking for a check in at 12 pm. Check in time was 3 pm and staff said 50 will be charged if I wanted a room now. they have avaliable rooms. Rooms were decent. I have never hated a hotel so much before. I will want all solo female travellers to know that this hotel is not safe and it had affected how I feel about LA very strongly. I feared for my own saefty 50 of the time cuz of the location and service of this hotel.

Everything else was perfect. The price you are told when booking is the actual price you pay. Anything you needed was in walking distance. As well the property it self was great. They could have discounted the rate seeing that there was no breakfast because of renovations going on.

The inside of the hotel was still under construction but the room was fantastic. The only option was to valet your car which it said 38 on hotelcom and they charged me 46 was a little upsetting. You think you getting a great deal and there was all these extra taxes and fees.

The place was very nice and clean for a 3star hotel. The location was great and the front desk did help us with anything we needed. Although the room was quite small with a small window to the outside. Also the valet was very expensive and someone rummaged through the glove compartment after contacting the manager the issue was taken care of.
